channel.title: The 20,000 Facebook Likes Challenge
channel.description:
Been roaming for a while.
![](upload://6I6PuuEmauXO02up6hgyYXrei26.jpeg)
Might it be a new website? Doubts will be cast of course. It could be a fake (okay probably not fake), or a small release. Is the 20,000 likes even possible? Optimism has certainly become taboo in this corner of the internet, but speculation is interesting.

item.title: The 20,000 Facebook Likes Challenge
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
acade365:

That could double Google+ user count!

This is the first time a signature has fit a post so well.

Read full topic

item.title: The 20,000 Facebook Likes Challenge
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
Comrade Tiki:

In that case, they should get a plan in the works now to release Xen at 60,000 Likes. and/or 20,000 +1s.

That could double Google+ user count!

Read full topic

item.title: The 20,000 Facebook Likes Challenge
item.dc:creator: CygNuS
item.description:
JerseyRyan:

I don’t know what’s the exact point of the whole social marketing campaing, but if it’s “building up the hype” then yes: It has to be a predictable process otherwise you will just end up with waves of people losing interest with the subject.

That’s obvious for us, let’s suppose it is for the devs too

Read full topic

item.title: The 20,000 Facebook Likes Challenge

item.description:

I don’t know what’s the exact point of the whole social marketing campaing, but if it’s “building up the hype” then yes

seems like you answered your question.

"you will just end up with waves of people losing interest with the subject. "

I had to lol at that a bit. Tiny bit.

Read full topic

item.title: The 20,000 Facebook Likes Challenge
item.dc:creator: JerseyRyan
item.description:
Raminator:

I don’t know how much warning there’ll be before the next stage, but hopefully things will proceed more regularly and predictably from there.

I don’t know what’s the exact point of the whole social marketing campaing, but if it’s “building up the hype” then yes: It has to be a predictable process otherwise you will just end up with waves of people losing interest with the subject.

Read full topic

item.title: The 20,000 Facebook Likes Challenge
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
And yet there are so many whiners who bitch because they have to click the “like” button. You should see some of these people, I saw a whole argument about how this whole thing was just advertising bullshit and that the BM team is using people as personal billboards, and that it’s offensive

Holy fuck people are brain dead

over 30,000 likes btw

Read full topic

item.title: The 20,000 Facebook Likes Challenge
item.dc:creator: Guzzi
item.description:
Madcat1030:

I love it when people try to correct others on denotation without any knowledge of connotation or common sayings. Diametrically opposed is one of my favorite sayings. You don’t just be diametric to an idea (that sounds silly), you are diametrically opposed to it

Holy shit! There are intellectuals on these forums!

I find it pretty damn impressive that it took… What, 2 days? to garner OVER 20,000 likes on facebook.

Word of mouth is pretty sweet. It also shows that people are really looking forward to the mod.

I imagine the devs find it very motivating/inspirational… Or they just want to finish the damn thing and be done with it. James/Ram are you guys inspired/surprised by the response on facebook?

Can’t wait till your guys’ next update, whatever and whenever that may be.

Read full topic

item.title: The 20,000 Facebook Likes Challenge
item.dc:creator: Artic_Xiongmao
item.description:
Yeah, really. That way we would know if the timetable for this media release is really spread out our not -we really have no idea if we should expect new screenshots in weeks, or if we are here waiting for summer to be over, or hell, maybe 2012. I don’t know about a countdown on facebook, that’d just frustrate a lot of people (“Why don’t just relese them now?! whine whine”), but you could at least give some vague direction here in the forums…

So… are we talking “waiting for weeks” here, or more like months or seasons?

Read full topic

item.title: The 20,000 Facebook Likes Challenge
item.dc:creator: Nightblade
item.description:
Yeah but it’s starting to dive me a little nutty. :retard:

How about instead of us just wondering when the next media release is going to be, you supply a link on faceboook with a countdown timer to the next release? In the fashion of the fan counter that Hubicorn gave us.

I think, imho, that it would go a long way to culling a simple frustration as well as giving us a point to look forward to.
It’s the next best thing to a release date. Mull it over.

Side note; Tyrion Lannister is awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: The 20,000 Facebook Likes Challenge
item.dc:creator: Kaweebo
item.description:
Artlav:

We’re waiting, James. It’s what we do.

Well some of us moan and complain but, yeah, I’d say we wait a lot, too.

Read full topic

item.title: The 20,000 Facebook Likes Challenge
item.dc:creator: Artlav
item.description:
JamesKane:

You will you know if another event/message only after we have posted it on facebook and/or twitter.
Any speculation or claims made on or about what would happen on ‘X’ likes is hearsay and should be treated as such.

Expect nothing until we say something.

We’re waiting, James. It’s what we do.

Read full topic
